revised_title: Observations on New England's Plants and Vegetation
tldr: The author, Paul Dudley, discusses the growth and success of various fruit trees and plants in New England, including apple, pear, peach, and cherry trees, as well as the impressive size and productivity of certain wood trees. He also observes the remarkable pumpkin seed that grew into a vine producing 260 pumpkins and the phenomenon of color interchanging in Indian corn.
